posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Time for another disgustingly powerful build.

I wrote this build for a character that i liked - one of the great dark lords in the Wheel of Time series, this build combines the Dragonic and Unholy powers and finishes off with a Destructive Bard Song.

There is one build that resembles this one, The Song of Despair by Revenant Mattlov --> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 06842.html

But with Curse Song at 40th lvl and with no Divine Might or any combat options and lower AB & DMG than this one.

I won't write down what this build can do when fully buffed casue we all know i will need two pages more, so i will rather direct you to the build itself and i will just include (in some cases)

the benefits of the unbuffed Bard Song which is rather permanent on her.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey dude!

This build is illegal. BG requires Cleave. It's workable in there, but you do need to take it before you take the first level of BG. I suppose Still Spell goes down the hill in this case, right?

I'd also swap Armor Skin with EWF and EWF with EP. At that level you'll hardly be needing AB as much as you'll need AC. Basically, I'd take AS first, then EWF, then EP. I would also go for a 1-handed weapon in this toon. I know 2-handed does A LOT more damage, but you don't have PM levels to be immune to crits, nor do you have any means of increasing your AC except Bard Song (you don't take Divine Shield), which doesn't kick in until much later in the build. Maybe you can take WF in a weapon like Warhammer (bludgeoning), and carry a very welcome shield to increase your survivability and carry around a Greatsword as a backup weapon. Then you could drop Improved Critical for IKD or Expertise. I'd go with Expertise for the combo with Taunt. Last, I'd keep Discipline over Taunt and drop Spellcraft. IMO for this build, Taunting is more useful than saves vs spells.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
And i was happy with my newfounded bonus feat :/

Let me fix that and take upon some of your suggestions as well Max.


Moghedien is now focused in Scimitars which allows her the use of a T. Shield and thus advancing even more her already incredible AC.

She retains her KD and Still Spell feats so she can cast while in combat and don't have to undress each time she wants to cast a spell.

She retains the order of the Epic Feats (offensive first) because the T. Shield gave her the additional AC she might needed.

With her ability to keen her Scimitar all day long the critical threat range is now 15-20 equal to a keen Greatsword with the Improved Critical feat, that's enough.

Divin Shield and Expertise feats are not needed. The reason for that is that Moghedien with a very conservative +5 equipment can reach an incredible 74 AC.

Moreover the use of Divine Shield would easily make her hit the Dodge Cap and thus not utilising the extra AC to the fullest.

Taunt skill can and should be selected in place of Discipline, she will probably be clad in KD immune gear (UMD) or her AC will be so high that the enemies won't use KD on her at all, (I have seen that in multiple occasions).

Dropping Spellcraft which offers her a massive (+10 bonus to all her saves Vs spells) in favor of Taunt though is not an option.

If nothing else her AB is so sky high that she doesn't need Taunt at all, these tricks are best suited to less powerful toons. Her, with an operational 68 AB won't need it, but if you want to have it then take it in place of Discipline.


Many people (not the vet's) will hear me talking about all these massive numbers and wondering how is that possible with this character, she is just a Bard, right?

Just three examples to see what i am talking about in a modest +5 environment.


Moghedien AC: 10 (base) + 8 (tumble) + 2 (AS) + 4 (RDD) + 4 (haste) + 13 (plate +5) + 8 (T. shield +5) + 1 (cat's) + 6 (26th lvl song) + 2 (curse song) + 1 (m. armour) + 5 (amulet +5) + 5 (ring +5) + 5 (sun soul +5 via umd) = 74 AC

Moghedien AB: 26 (base) + 21 (buffed STR) + 4 (focusses) + 2 (Bard Song) + 6 (Curse Song) + 2 (War Cry) + 2 (aid+bless potions) + 5 (Scimitar +5) + 6 (Taunt - if taken) = 74 AB

Moghedien Taunt Skill: 43 Ranks + 9 (buffed CHA) + 15 (26th lvl Bard Song) + 15 (26th lvl Curse Song) = 82 Taunt

Most impressive is the fact that for these numbers you won't even need special equipment or massive buffing. Almost everything comes from herself and is undispellable except from Mord's, and Bard Song isn't dispellable at all.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
A resourceful concept for sure.  Using BG to solve the saves problem characteristic with RDDs... nice touch.  And deferring to a Taunt allocation also a smart choice.

A few minor points for those keeping score...

Alignment restriction is actually NE/CE.  Neither will protect against pally smites.

Bard 26 will result in awesome penetration for offensive spells even without support feats and indispellable buffs except for Mords.  The only issue is that casting attempts of those sweet 10d6 AoE ice storms will force this toon to either go robed w/o shield or use the Level 6 castings exclusively for stilled Level 5 spells, else suffer the 95% somatic failure (assuming fullplate/tower, of course).  Alas, no Autostill available for bardic casting (not this build, anyway).

Just think how easy it would be to level this toon with a skill schedule displayed!  Super easy.

Yes, I know.  That was exactly my point. Once you've used all your Level 6 casts for Ice Storms, it doesn't leave any room for Stilled Healing Circle, Greater Dispelling and other somatic spells if you planned to toggle between robed and armored gear.

The only problem i ever had with these types of toons, much like with "Andariel", was that i got bored.. It really is that powerful, especially in the hands of one that can play her properly. You will also notice that i purposely avoided going the dev crit route there, although i already was forced to take two of the pre-requisite feats, cause that would make her totaly ridiculous, at least in an environment that the feat is allowed as is. For that modification, i would probably take out AS and two great STR's and fit in there IC/OW/DEV critical. Then with a buffed 50 Str plus Curse song i would proceed to deliver DC 52 Dev Crits from 12-20 all over the place... But it gets boring after a while, that's why i try many times to do something without it, much like i don't use (TS/2X Max IGMS + TS/ 3X Emp IGMS) to instant-kill every Boss.

I pretty much agree with you with the split of this build, mostly because in PW's at some point it stops to be about yourself and becomes more about the "party", and that's why we play in PW's right? To play with other people as well, so a Bard's awesome all-day-long song boosts everyone's abilities and for that you need an epic Bard. That's why Bard 24/26 is always a "must" in my book, when design a toon like that. The other two classes can differ as much as they want, but as long as you have the epic song/curse, you are doing it right.

Thanks for your comments, much appreciated ;)

Hi Valerfor, HipRedux and ECBers

I love this build and I've got to try it.

Just thought I would comment regarding potential paladin smites. In modules which allow alignment change it could be pretty simple to shift from NE to TN once you have done with your Blackguard levels, at level 12. I've recently done a bit of research and posted in our game guides section of the forum into the practical aspects of alignment changes.

Firstly Valerfor's build allows the player 12 levels (Bard 8, Blackguard 4) to make your alignment borderline NE (ie Neutral (50) Evil (29)), which is like, one and a half whole modules. You might achieve this goal early, you can just then then just hover there at that alignment getting ready to shift once you have done with Blackguard. You could very feasibly achieve this in a popular module such as Aielund Act 1 and Act 2. 

Once you get Blackguard 4 you can just have a Good shifting conversational option and suddenly your alignment has shifted from Neutral (50) Evil (29) to True Neutral (50, 50). And now Moghedien is 'Smite proof'.

Moghedien could even go on to be 'reformed' to be a good character as the modules progress as you retain your blackguard abilities with this shift (just not the ability to further level BG, which you no longer need after you get Bull's Strength, Divine Might and Dark Blessing!)

I guess the only issue would be if certain servers or module dont allow such alignment changes in characters to load into them. Then you could just simply disregard what I've written

Anyway just in case you wanted to make this overpowered build even stronger to make yourself 'smite' proof. Feel free to check the NWN Wiki on alignment and/or my post if this is confusing.

Apr 07, 2020
Can someone post a Dev Crit version of this build, preferably with either a skill progression, or just highlights of the skill progression?
In post #10 Valefor tells you how to easily get dev crit.

As for the skill progression, skills don't have to be taken at any one level unless you play on a Persistent World that requires it.  So just think of it more as what do you need at the moment.    Hide and Lore are pre-reqs for BG and RDD, so go for those first.  

If you world has a lot of Knockdown/Disarm then also max Discipline every level.  Umd helps with everything you want to use but normally cant.. so keep that filled.  Perform handles your Bard Songs/Curses.. so max that every Bard level.   Tumble is only really useful in blocks of 5, so when you can add 5 points at a time, do so....

So while a skill sheet is nice, it isn't that difficult to let the flow of the game dictate which ones need boosting at each level...

SpoilerIf you play Aielund (or any other module) with EMS there are several changes to the Bard class: You get Weapon Proficiency Rogue. You get 6 skill points per level + int bonus (x4 at lvl 1) You have the following extra spells to choose from: Banishment as C5 Dominate Monster as C6 Endurance as C2 Freedom Of Movement as C4 Greater Shadow Conjuration as C5 Mass Charm as C6 Ray Of Frost as C0 Shadow Conjuration as C4 Stoneskin as C4 The Bard song and Curse song  are changed: Every 6 levels starting at Bard 1: +1 AB, +1 Damage (Bard 1, 7, 13, 19, 25 etc) Every 6 levels starting at Bard 3: +1 Fort Every 6 levels starting at Bard 5: +1 Reflex There is no level 30 song cap At lvl 16 the bonus is: +3 AB, +3 Damage, +3 AC, +3 Fort, +3 Will, +2 Refl, +2 skills, +12 HP, and there is not a clearly defined "Sweet spot" at lvl 16 anymore. Lasting Impression is only 2x normal song duration (i.e. 20 rounds)
